org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.util

Class ZipUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.utils.FileUtils
      • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.util.ZipUtils
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JarUtils

    @PublicAPI
public class ZipUtils
extends FileUtils
    Utils for creating and reading zip files.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 3.0

    • Method Detail

      • zip

        public static void zip(String[] directoriesAndFiles,
                       File dest,
                       CRC32 crc)
                throws IOException
        Create a zip file on the given directoriesAndFiles argument and store the create content in a file denoted by the path in the given dest argument
        Parameters:
        directoriesAndFiles - the directories and files to zip (recursively)
        dest - the zip destination file that will contains the zipped version of the first argument.
        crc - the CRC32 of all zipentries. Can be null if no crc is needed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the zip file cannot be created.

      • zipDirectoriesAndFiles

        public static void zipDirectoriesAndFiles(ZipOutputStream zos,
                                          String[] directoriesAndFiles,
                                          CRC32 crc)
                                   throws IOException
        Create a zip file that contains all the directory listed in directories parameter.
        Parameters:
        zos - output stream destination
        directoriesAndFiles - the list of directories and files to be zipped.
        crc - the CRC32 of all zipentries. Can be null if no crc is needed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during the compression

      • zipIt

        protected static void zipIt(ZipOutputStream zos,
                            String[] directoriesAndFiles,
                            CRC32 crc)
                     throws IOException
        Zip directory content in the given output stream
        Parameters:
        zos - the output stream in which to store the zipped directory
        directoriesAndFiles - a list of directories and files to be zipped
        Throws:
        IOException - if a zip entry cannot be created.

      • zipDirectory

        protected static void zipDirectory(String directoryName,
                                   int iBaseFolderLength,
                                   ZipOutputStream zos,
                                   CRC32 crc)
                            throws IOException
        Add the given directory into the zipStream.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - the directory to be added in the zip.
        iBaseFolderLength - the index in the directoryName from which starts the actual zip entry name.
        zos - the stream to write into.
        crc - the CRC32 of all zipentries. Can be null if no crc is needed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the zip file cannot be written.

      • zipFile

        protected static void zipFile(String filePath,
                              int iBaseFolderLength,
                              ZipOutputStream jos,
                              CRC32 crc)
                       throws IOException
        Add a file into a zip.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the file to be added in the zip.
        iBaseFolderLength - the index in the directoryName from which starts the actual zip entry name.
        jos - the stream to write into.
        crc - the CRC32 of all zipentries. Can be null if no crc is needed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the zip file cannot be written.

      • unzip

        public static void unzip(ZipFile zipFile,
                         File dest)
                  throws IOException
        Unzip a zip file into a directory.
        Parameters:
        zipFile - The zip file to be unzipped.
        dest - the destination directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the destination does not exist or is not a directory, or if the zip file cannot be extracted.

        protected static void createFileWithPath(File f)
                                  throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException
